result.execSummary:
The defendant David Wade Bradshaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 149 days if it has not been applied to Brown County cases.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Payable out of 25% of prison monies, balance as a condition of community supervision.  Work out payment plan with agent.
Make regular payments toward court obligations, restitution and DOC supervision fees.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample today (3-21-16) & pay surcharge.
Complete a psychological assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations or medications prescribed.

No contact with S.M.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Not to be in any locations where alcohol or drugs are used, sold or possessed such as residences, liquor stores, liquor departments, etc.

Comply with COMPAS assessments and recommendations.
Gain approval from your agent prior to engaging in a romantic or sexual relationship.
Take all medications prescribed by your doctor.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
